alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:12PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern DeKalb County through 400 PM CDT... At 312 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rainsville to near Fyffe to Geraldine. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Crossville, Sylvania, Fyffe, Geraldine, Valley Head, Hammondville, Pine Ridge and Lakeview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
